Dear [Patient Name],

I am writing to provide you with a summary of your recent hospital stay from March 10 to March 12, 2024. Over these days, our primary focus was attending to your acute symptoms and ensuring your condition was carefully monitored and managed.

Upon your arrival on March 10, 2024, you presented with symptoms of chest pain and shortness of breath. An ECG was performed, revealing ST elevation in leads V5-6, which prompted immediate admission for suspected ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) involving the left main coronary artery, confirmed the following day.

To address your condition, our team administered a standard treatment regimen known as MONAC (Morphine, Oxygen, Nitrates, Aspirin, Clopidogrel), tailored to manage the myocardial infarction. On March 11, 2024, your laboratory tests showed elevated levels of Troponin T, at 30 and 29 respectively, indicative of cardiac stress and supporting the diagnosis of myocardial infarction. Despite attempts to align your acute management with local protocols indicating potential percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), communication with the catheterization lab was not successful due to external constraints. However, our cardiology team continuously evaluated your situation, and the necessary medical interventions were administered.

During your stay, Morphine was prescribed for pain control, Oxygen was provided when saturation fell below 90%, Nitroglycerin was administered in specific dosages, and a single chewed dose of Aspirin was given as an anticoagulant. As the days progressed, your symptoms improved, leading to your request for discharge on March 12, 2024, following the resolution of your chest pain.

Please feel free to reach out to your healthcare provider or our hospital should you experience any recurring symptoms or have concerns regarding your recovery. It is important to follow up with your cardiologist to ensure continued care and to discuss any potential lifestyle changes that may be necessary for your heart health.

We wish you a smooth and swift recovery. It was our privilege to provide you with care, and we remain at your service for any future healthcare needs.

Sincerely,
